title: Tips To Help You Recover From Guillain Barre Syndrome Fast
author: Heather Hanks
description: Guillain barre syndrome is an autoimmune disease that attacks the nerves and can lead to balance problems. Learn the treatment options here.
cleaned_text: Andre Budihardjo](/en-us/reviewer/dr-andre-budihardjo/) on November 29, 2022 Tips To Help You Recover From Guillain Barre Syndrome Fast Published | 5 min read There is no cure for Guillain barre syndrome, which can cause muscle pain and weakness. However, Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM) can help manage symptoms so you can recover quicker. As an autoimmune disease, The condition is characterized by [pain](https://www.allthingshealth.com/en-us/natural-products/healing-foods/natural-pain-relief/), muscle weakness, balance and coordination problems, and a numb or prickly sensation in the limbs. Despite being rare, it can lead to paralysis and life-threatening complications, such as breathing problems and [blood clots](https://www.allthingshealth.com/en-us/general-health/cardiovascular-health/blood-disorders/). It can affect people of all ages, but men more so than women. In this article, we'll discuss what causes a Guillain barre syndrome infection and tips for keeping yourself healthy if you have been diagnosed. What Is Guillain Barre Syndrome? Guillain barre syndrome (GBS) occurs when the immune system mistakenly attacks healthy nerves in the hands and feet. The condition can happen a few days or weeks after a respiratory or [gastrointestinal infection](https://www.allthingshealth.com/en-us/general-health/digestive-health/gastrointestinal-disease/). Some infections that make a person vulnerable to GBS include: [HIV](https://www.allthingshealth.com/en-us/general-health/energy-and-immunity/hiv-symptoms/) [Influenza virus](https://www.allthingshealth.com/en-us/general-health/respiratory-health/cold-flu-symptoms/) - Cytomegalovirus - Epstein-Barr virus - Hepatitis A, B, C, and E - Dengue fever - Glandular fever - Zika virus [COVID-19 virus](https://www.allthingshealth.com/en-us/general-health/energy-and-immunity/early-covid-symptoms/) - Surgery - Trauma [Food poisoning](https://www.allthingshealth.com/en-us/general-health/digestive-health/stomach-flu-remedies/)due to the consumption of foods or beverages that contain the Campylobacter jejuni bacteria (often found in undercooked poultry) In [Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM)](https://www.allthingshealth.com/en-us/traditional-chinese-medicine/), the occurrence of a GBS infection relates to pathogenic factors. " Senior TCM Physician Brandon Yew. Treatment Options For Guillain Barre Syndrome The condition is incurable and impairs physical functioning. However, the silver lining is that clinical care can help patients recover over time. These will run over several weeks or months and may require hospital admission. TCM, meanwhile, can speed up recovery from a GBS infection. Intravenous immunoglobulin therapy (IVIG) People with a GBS infection are given IVIG in a few large doses. It has a high concentration and diverse collection of antibodies and is prepared from blood donated by thousands of people. IVIG is also used to treat various other autoimmune and infectious diseases. It has the same effect on medical conditions that stem from an unknown cause. These are called idiopathic diseases or conditions. Plasma exchange (Plasmapheresis) The treatment helps remove excess antibodies, abnormal proteins, or harmful substances from the blood. Hence, plasma exchange is a viable option to treat or manage autoimmune, blood, or nervous system disorders. It uses a machine to pull plasma - the liquid portion of blood - from blood cells. The latter is then mixed with a substitute and returned to the body. Herbal decoctions TCM recognizes that the pathological subtypes of GBS have specific effects on different body constitutions. Thus, Physician Yew recommends using [herbal formulas](https://www.allthingshealth.com/en-us/natural-products/supplements/herbal-medicine-basics/) to correct imbalances within the visceral organs or meridians, fibrous tissues (sinews), spinal muscles, and joints. Examples of these - Fu Ling Wan - Si Ni San - Si Ni Tang - Xuan Bi Tang - Yi Yi Ren Tang You can also take [American Wild Ginseng Capsules](https://www.euyansang.com/en_US/herbs/ginseng/american-wild-ginseng-capsules-955764734501.html) to reduce inflammation and pain [Cordyceps](https://shop.euyansang.com/us/Cordyceps-Capsules/MI-8888100.html) for [bird's nest](https://shop.euyansang.com/us/Premium-Concentrated-Bird%27s-Nest---Rock-Sugar/MI-8888107.html) t Acupuncture and acupressure In clinical therapy, acupuncture helps suppress nervous system inflammation. It also promotes healing and recovery of nerve functions. TCM also uses the treatment to lower a person's risk of disease. It does this by unblocking meridian channels, restoring organ function, and enhancing blood and qi circulation. [Acupressure](https://www.allthingshealth.com/en-us/general-health/energy-and-immunity/acupressure-benefits/) is a massage technique used alongside acupuncture to achieve similar benefits. The acupressure points that are associated with an improvement of GBS symptoms include: - Jing Ming (BL1), Bai Hui (DU20), and Yang Bai (GB14) for alertness, cognition, mood, vision, and facial movement - Tian Tu (RN22), Di Cang (ST4), Jia Che (ST6), and Xia Guan (ST7) for speech, chewing, and swallowing - He Gu (LI4), Shou San Li (LI10), Qu Chi (LI11), Bi Nao (LI14), Lao Gong (PC8), and Wai Guan (SJ5) for pain, numbness and weakness in the upper body Early intervention can help the symptoms of a GBS infection resolve naturally.
